div.l: He gan to gruche ⁊and blamet it a lite
So the yke qduod he ful wel couth I ȝow qwytewyteqwyte
With bleryng of a proude millers Eye
If þat me list to speke of rybaudye
But yk am old me list not play for age
Gras tyme is don̄ my fodder is forage
This white top writeþ myn old ȝeres
Myn hert is Also mouled as myn heres
But if I fare as doth a open Ers
That ilke fruyt is eủer þᵉ leng̉er þe wers
Til it be roten in Mullok or in stree
We old men I drede so fare we
Tylle we be roten kan we nought be ripe
We hoppen Alway wile þe world wil pipe
For in oure wille þer stiketh eủer a naile
To haue an hoor here and a grene taile
As hath a leke for þough oure myght be gon̄
Oure wille desireþ folye eủere in oon
For whan we may nought don þan wille we speke
Ȝet in oure asshen old is fyre y reke
Foure gledes han we wiche I shal deuyse
Auauntyng lying Angyr couetise
This foure sparkeles longith vn to ȝeld
Oure old lymes Mow wel ben vn weld
But wil ne shal not failen þat is soth
And ȝet haue I Alway a coltes tothe
As mony a ȝer as it is passid henne
Syn þat my tappe of lyf be gan to renne
For sikerly whan I was borne a none
Deth droughe þe tappe of lif ⁊and let it gone
And eủere sythen hath so þe tappe I ronne
Til þat Almost al empty is þe tonne
The streme of lif no droppith on þe chymbe
The Sely tong may wel ryng ⁊and chymbe
Of wrechednes þat passid is ful ȝore
With old folke saue dotage is no more
